CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 28, 1953, pg. 6, reads: "Red Cross Drive Workers Meet - Red Cross workers in the Upper Hill area met at the home of Mrs. Joseph G. Moss, 748 Adelaide Street, last week, to make plans for solicitations in the area.  Among those present were, standing: Mrs. William W. Goode, vice chairman of the Pittsburgh Red Cross; Mrs. John Dunson, Mrs. Henry Colbert and Mrs. Charles Slocum.  Sitting: Mrs. Ruth David, Mrs. Ellis Nored, Mrs. Joseph G. Moss, Mrs. John Brice and Mrs. Erlen Taylor.  In the front row are Miss Jean Bell and Miss Sherlynn Dudley. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Red Cross workers, standing from left: Sarah Goode, Mrs. John Dunson, Mrs. Henry Colbert, Mrs. Charles Slocum; sitting: Mrs. Ruth David, Mrs. Ellis Nored, Mrs. Joseph G. Moss, Mrs. John Brice, Mrs. Erlen Taylor; with Jean Bell and Sherlynn Dudley on floor in front, in Moss home, 748 Adelaide Street
